Package simpopulation

Class Population<T extends Organism<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpopulation.Population<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - generic type that implements Organism
    public class Population<T extends Organism<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic class, that models the state of an living organism population and gives an interface for addition and removal of specimens. Also keeps track of the fittest organism in memory.
    Author:
    group16

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Population​(PopulationSimulation<T> popSimul, java.util.LinkedList<T> pioneers, int maxPop)

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addSpecimen​(Specimen<T> newSpecimen)
      Adds a new specimen to the population, creating the corresponding death,reproduction and mutation events Throws exception if the maximum population size is exceeded
      void epidemic()
      The population suffers an epidemic.
      T getFittest()
      Finds fittest specimen
      void printState()
      Prints current population state
      void removeAllDead()
      Removes all dead specimens from the specimens list
      void removeDead()
      Removes the first dead specimen found from the specimens list

                 throws ExceedsPopulation

        Parameters:
        newSpecimen - Specimen to add
        Throws:
